course_title: Freshman Seminar: Slavery in Ancient Rome
class_notes:
(Same as CL 190 1)
(Freshmen Only)


Instructor is newly-hired Prof. Jinyu Liu, Betty Gage Holland Professor of Roman History.


Examines the origins, theorization, institutionalization, and forms of slavery in the Roman World. Investigate the lived experiences of enslaved people and their roles in the Roman society, economy, religion, and family relations. Explores what sustained ancient slavery and how it ended.
course_description: Introduces first-year students to the discipline of history, particularly historical sources and methods; aims to improve critical reading, analytical, and writing skills in small group discussion.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 5610, Section #: 6, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: J. Liu, Status: Closed
